channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: My Word for 2024: Strong
item.description:
Before I begin, know that I fully recognize that it’s May.   I selected my word of the year way back in December of 2023.  After letting it marinade for a few days, I spent an hour looking for the perfect bracelet on Etsy that would display its letters each and every day.  I also knew...

item.title: How To Start A Successful Health Coaching Business (Yes, You Can!)
item.description: Start your journey helping people make life-changing health shifts.

item.title: Mayo Clinic Minute: Navigating nutrition for heart health
item.description:
Could a short diet questionnaire encourage patients to make better food choices and improve heart health? In the past, your healthcare team had to rely on lengthy surveys to better understand what you were eating. But that's all changed with the Mini-EAT assessment tool. Dr. Francisco Lopez-Jimenez, a Mayo Clinic cardiologist, explains how this free, […]

The post Mayo Clinic Minute: Navigating nutrition for heart health appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network.

item.title: The Sound of Freedom
item.description:
For a million years (more like 15,) I’ve been listening to a radio show:  The Taylor Strecker Show. It’s a daily show that originated on SiriusXM and through a series of events became an independently broadcasted show on Patreon.  There’s something interesting that happens when you listen to a daily show.  You get to know...

item.title: No Lie, This Supplement Is Like The Fountain Of Youth For Your Skin
item.description: Do you do your skin care routine morning and night? Great. But there's more you can do. Here's how to approach skin aging from the inside out.

item.title: NIH award supports new center at Mayo Clinic for health disparities in uterine fibroid treatment
item.description:
Uterine fibroids, noncancerous tumors of the uterus, affect about 70% of white women and up to 90% of Black women according to the National Institutes of Health (NIH). Fibroid symptoms may include heavy menstrual bleeding, pelvic pain, bowel and bladder problems, and sometimes infertility and miscarriage. For women of African descent, fibroids may develop at […]

The post NIH award supports new center at Mayo Clinic for health disparities in uterine fibroid treatment appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network.

item.title: That Time I Went to the Eras Tour [Part Two]
item.description:
To review part one of this adventure with Taylor Swift, click here. Click here to see all the Instagram highlight videos from Denver Night One. item.title: In A Financial Pinch? 7 Small Savings Tips That Add Up To Big Savings
item.description: Don’t dismiss the power of baby steps, especially when it comes to saving money. Small money moves can add up to big savings.

item.title: New research discovers a new combination of therapy for people with a type of leukemia, leading them to live longer
item.description:
ROCHESTER, Minn. — In a new multicenter international study led by the Mayo Clinic Comprehensive Cancer Center, researchers found that people with the B-cell precursor subtype of acute lymphoblastic leukemia (BCP-ALL), who also lacked a genetic abnormality known as the Philadelphia chromosome and were in remission with no trace of cancer, showed significantly higher survival rates […]

The post New research discovers a new combination of therapy for people with a type of leukemia, leading them to live longer appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network.

item.title: That Time I Went to the Eras Tour [Part One]
item.description:
Do you ever have one of those experiences where you want to remember exactly how you felt?  That’s how I feel about my experience at the Taylor Swift concert this weekend.  Correction:  At the Eras Tour.  Saying it was a concert does not feel like enough to justify the magnitude of the event. Let’s talk about the...

item.title: A 7-Week Plan To Master Pull-Ups (& Why This Move Is A+ For Healthy Aging)
item.description: Pull-ups are way more than just a flex—they can actively boost longevity and health span.

item.title: Detecting pancreatic cancer through changes in body composition and metabolism
item.description:
Pancreatic cancer is a formidable disease, often diagnosed too late for effective treatment. However, new research from Mayo Clinic represents a promising step toward identifying biological signals or biomarkers that may aid in early detection. By tracking changes in body composition and metabolism, researchers are working to identify high-risk patients who could benefit from selective […]

The post Detecting pancreatic cancer through changes in body composition and metabolism appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network.

item.title: Jenny Craig Recipe Creation: Turkey Philly Baguette
item.description:

item.title: Are Creatine Supplements Bad For Your Kidneys? What's Fact vs. Fiction
Mayo Clinic Minute: Reducing thumb arthritis pain
item.description:
Thousands of Americans suffer from thumb arthritis. This disorder can greatly affect daily life and can make it a struggle to do simple things like opening doors or holding objects. Dr. Sanj Kakar, a Mayo Clinic orthopedic surgeon who specializes in wrist and hand disorders, explains the condition and available treatments. Watch: The Mayo Clinic […]

The post Mayo Clinic Minute: Reducing thumb arthritis pain appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network.
